example_code:
import base64
from email.message import EmailMessage
import google.auth
from googleapiclient.discovery import build
from googleapiclient.errors import HttpError

creds, _ = google.auth.default()
service = build('gmail', 'v1', credentials=creds)
message = EmailMessage()
message.set_content('This is an automated draft email')
message['To'] = 'testuser@test.com'
message['From'] = 'testuser@test.com'
message['Subject'] = 'Automated Draft'

encoded_message = base64.urlsafe_b64_encode(message.as_bytes()).decode()
create_message={'message':{'raw':encoded_message}}

draft = service.users().drafts().create(userId='me', body=create_message).execute()

meta_data.description: To use the drafts.create method, the general process is to (1) create a MIME message that complies with RFC 2822, (2) convert the message to a base64url encoded string, and (3) create a draft, setting the value of the drafts.message.raw field to the encoded string.

questions: I am a student and want to send an email to my professor asking for an extension on my assignment
I need help creating an email invitation for an upcoming corporate event
I want to send an email to Joe to schedule a meeting next week
